sec.p: Analysis of the EOP MIC data revealed that at a 500 μg/mL concentration, 100% death of trophozoites was observed. After 24 h of exposure, EOP demonstrated optimal anti- T. vaginalis activity at a concentration of 500 μg/mL with an IC 50 value of 100 μg/mL ( Fig 1). The negative control and DMSO control showed positive motility and did not stain with Trypan blue (0.4%), whereas the positive control stained blue and exhibited negative motility at the 24 h time point in all assays performed. When the kinetic growth curve was analyzed, it was observed that the exposure to 500 μg/mL of EOP reduced the growth of trophozoites by 36% at 12 h and induced complete parasite death at 24 h ( Fig 2).

div.div: Trichomonas vaginalis 30236 isolate; MIC and IC 50 after 24-hour-treatments with EOP at 25, 50, 100, 200, 300, 400, 500 μg/mL.
div.p: Data represent mean ± standard deviation of at least three experiments, all in triplicate. Different letters indicate a significant difference (p < 0.05).

div.div: Kinetic growth curve of the Trichomonas vaginalis 30236 isolate after exposure to EOP at 500 μg/mL for 1 h, 6 h, 12 h, 24 h, 48 h, 72 h and 96 h.
div.p: Data represent mean ± standard deviation of at least three experiments, all in triplicate. Different letters indicate a significant difference (p < 0.05).
